snippet: A London-based journalism group said 50 civilians had been killed in strikes in Pakistan as they tried to help, and more than 20 others died in strikes on funerals.
abstract: British and Pakistani journalists say that the Central Intelligence Agency's drone strikes on suspected militants in Pakistan have repeatedly targeted civilian rescuers who responded to the scene of a strike, as well as mourners at subsequent funerals; American officials question report's findings and assert that top-secret drone campaign specifically targets known terrorists.
lead_paragraph: A London-based journalism group said 50 civilians had been killed in strikes in Pakistan as they tried to help, and more than 20 others died in strikes on funerals.

headline.seo: U.S. Drone Strikes Are Said to Target Rescuers
headline.main: U.S. Said to Target Rescuers at Drone Strike Sites
headline.print_headline: U.S. Drone Strikes Are Said To Target Rescuers at Sites
